parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To fall down, fall prostrate. From kata and pipto; to fall down.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The Hebrew language, or rather: Aramaic. From Eber; the Hebraistic or Jewish language.
Of Hebrew origin; Saul, the Jewish name of Paul.
Of Hebrew origin; Saul, the Jewish name of Paul.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To pursue, hence: I persecute. A prolonged form of a primary verb dio; to pursue; by implication, to persecute.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Hard, violent, harsh, stern. From the base of skelos; dry, i.e. Hard or tough.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
To kick. From adverb lax; to recalcitrate.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
A sting, goad; met: of death. From kenteo; a point, i.e. A sting or goad.
